column1: Your surgeon made a cut in your vagina.
Your surgeon may have also used a laparoscope (a thin tube with a small camera on it) and other instruments that were inserted into your belly through several small incisions.
You will not have any scars on your skin unless your doctor used a laparoscope and other instruments that were inserted through your belly.
If you had problems with severe bleeding before your hysterectomy, sexual function often improves after surgery.
This includes douching or using tampons.
If your surgeon also used a laparoscope: - You may remove the wound dressings and take a shower the day after surgery if sutures (stitches), staples, or glue were used to close your skin.
Eat plenty of fruits and vegetables and drink 8 cups of water a day to keep from getting constipated To manage your pain: - Your provider will prescribe pain medicines to use at home.
